intro: Stephanoluma, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a genus of flowering plants native to the Andes mountains of South America. These plants are characterized by their showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to deep red. The leaves are typically large, heart-shaped, and have a rough texture. They thrive in high-altitude environments with cool, moist climates. Stephanoluma species are often cultivated for their ornamental value and are also used in traditional medicine.
